religion or the predominance of the Celtic
nations. Whatever of evil their agencies
may have contained sprung from the extinction
-tinction of the poetical principle caused

despotism and superstition. Men, from
causes too intricate to be discussed,
had become
had became insensible & selfish: thier own
wills had become feeble, & yet they were
it's slaves, & thence the slaves of the
will of others; superstition lust fear
avarice cruelty & fraud characterised
a race amongst whom no one was to
be found, capable of creating in form
language or institution. The moral
anomalies of such a state of society are
not justly to be charged upon any
class of events immediately connected with
events are
them, and those class is most entitled
to our approbation which dissolves it
most expeditiously. It is unfortunate
